statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: MD Baltimore Co 86, Vermont 73
article.story: CATONSVILLE, Md. (AP) -- Jerrell Dinkins scored a career-high 24 points, John Zito and Brian Hodges added 16 apiece and Maryland-Baltimore County defeated Vermont 86-73 on Saturday. Jay Greene and Chris Pugh each scored 13 points for the Retrievers (9-14, 5-7 America East), who had lost two straight and seven of nine. UMBC beat the Catamounts for the first time in seven meetings. Chris Holm matched a career-best with 24 points for Vermont (10-12, 6-6). Martin Klimes added 12 points and Mike Trimboli had 11. UMBC turned an 18-point halftime lead into a 65-41 cushion when Pugh's 3-pointer out of the left corner capped a 9-0 run with 11:50 remaining. But the Retrievers didn't score from the field for almost 6 minutes, and Vermont went on a 16-4 burst to cut the lead to 12. A 9-0 run by the Catamounts got the lead down to 11 with 1:10 to go, and Mike Trimboli's 3-pointer with 45.1 seconds left cut the deficit to 10. But that was as close at Vermont could get. In the first half, the Retrievers closed with a 12-3 surge featuring seven points from Dinkins. Holm had 11 first-half points for the Catamounts, who trailed 48-30 at the break.
